This documentary begins with an interesting premise -- it makes an intriguing and convincing argument that the history of Jesus as is commonly believed is probably a myth. Initially, the documentary offers a unique perspective and explores the depths of the history behind this belief. The creator of this movie is a former evangelical Christian and brings a personal touch, which adds depth and sincerity to the film. While it is provocative and challenging, it is not an all-out attack on Christianity. Rather, it provides a refreshing view of the historical context of Jesus and the religion he founded. It'd be interesting to see the first 20 minutes expanded to delve even deeper into the origins of the myth and the evidence that was presented to support it. Overall, the movie offers a fresh take on the topic and provides viewers with food for thought.

This straightforward movie was full of heart, boasting low budget, purposely gritty special effects. The comedic relief, Vlad, added a much needed light-hearted touch, while the strength of a God, in human form, showed its might as the pile of muscles. I invested in a worthwhile experience and was rewarded with a classic, nostalgic movie that won't get any better, but that's part of its charm.

anemic comedy-drama, unhappy, seemingly rushed affair featuring Cher as a powerful and emotional lead who slowly explores the highs and lows of being a woebegone housewife. Chazz Palminteri, as the talkative hired gun, adapted the screenplay from his own play, with authentic and engaging settings and back-and-forth dialogue that thought-provoking and emotional. An air of raw emotion and depth hangs over the entire project, and director Paul Mazursky allows Cher to truly embrace her emotions, displaying a strong emotional resonance. Despite all the top talent, including Robert De Niro as one of the producers, "Faithful" delivers a compelling and authentic story with rich, complex characters who fully-realize and come to life. 4 stars.

The witty banter comes off, and the backstage business is ripe. Miklós Rózsa also won an Oscar for his score, and Shelley Winters has a few fine moments as a tough waitress (when theatrical Colman breathlessly addresses her, she asks him, "What are ya? Some kind of nut?"). This scenario is obvious but funny, and not draggy. ****.

I read the novel 'Jane Eyre' for the first time back in 1986. It was round that time that I saw the BBC-version with Timothy Dalton and Zelah Clarke. It was a wonderful version and very much like the book. Years later, I laid eyes on this version and was pleasantly surprised. William Hurt's portrayal of Mr Rochester is a perfect casting, full of passion. Charlotte Gainsborough delivers a great performance as well. This is a story about love and passion, and I could see it in this version. Highly recommend watching the BBC-version, or the BBC-version is the one to see.

This low-budget intriguing war picture spotlights the spectacular Eve Meyer, a testament to the passion, commitment, and hard work of those involved. The well-crafted, thought-provoking screenplay delivers stellar performances that rival those of high-budget productions. The wholesome charm of the elementary-school Christmas pageant-style performances adds dimension and resonates with the audience. Dynamic, edge-of-your-seat action and brave, innovative direction make this a bold, experimental work. The award-winning visionary filmmaker's bold, innovative approach to genre mashing results in a deep, poignant analysis of war. The raw, authentic production values add to the overall feeling of a real, gritty, and inspiring film, with countless hidden treasures waiting to be discovered by the discerning film enthusiast. Appreciate her brilliant acting chops in this untold masterpiece.

Okay, the story is full of surprises, the characters are multi-faceted, the best dialogue is unpredictable, the cinematography is visually stunning, and the pinnacle of technical mastery saves the movie from being a muddle. For those who appreciate Peckinpah and his great work, this movie is a unique experience. Even a great cast rewards the patience of viewers. Watch the great Peckinpah films. Skip this masterpiece.

Rural family drama--with perhaps a nod to "Ordinary People"--concerns a young boy who withdraws into himself after fatally wounding his older brother in a shooting mishap. Due to the downbeat subject matter, the film explores some dynamics worth investigating with this sad story. Unfortunately, the isolated farming atmosphere and the eagerness of the adult characters to take charge of the situation renders the film a vibrant and engaging experience. What with Robert Duvall, Glenn Close, and Wilford Brimley in the cast, the movie is surprisingly abundant with talent behind the camera to eke out a gripping, memorable picture. *1/2 from ****

Gritty and atmospheric western from director Richard Brooks, who nimbly re-interprets classic western tropes. Early 1900s horse race attracts a gritty, determined cowboy (Gene Hackman), a polished, charismatic gambler (James Coburn), a confident and charming young cowboy (Jan Michael Vincent), and an exceptionally talented female racer (Candice Bergen). Once the thought-provoking and intense debates over whether or not a woman should take part are out of the way, this becomes a compelling western with rich characters and epic in length and scope. Visually stunning and full of electrifying energy and intensity, it pays homage to classic western tropes while adding its own fresh take on the genre. ****

After the opening credits, there's a minute of exhilarating tension building. A minute of nothing, then a girl wakes up and takes a shower.Then her and two college friends are driving to a rock concert, after much padding, they hit something and skid off the road. They awaken in a cabin inhabited by a wheelchair-bound old lady and her offspring. The killings are surprisingly very gruesome for a supposed Video Nasty. The fresh and unexpected plot twists keep the audience on the edge of their seats. Everyone involved in the mess have impressive follow-up careers. The sexy and tastefully done nudity scenes only add to the overall appeal of the movie. So my grade for this film would be a solid B.

Seriously. This is one of the most beloved family shows of all time.

Plot- A family without a mother and 3 "dads" raise 3 little girls in San Francisco, California.

Characters- Neat freak Danny, cartoon loving Joey, hair obsessed Jesse, spoiled brat Michelle, stupid DJ, and almost normal Stephanie. The creators of this show did an excellent job of making you love the characters.

Therefore, I believe that everyone should watch this show.

I laughed at many moments in the show's whole running.

If you're looking for a joyful and heartwarming TV show, look no further than Full House. A solid 8/10 or B.

"Bela Lugosi brings charisma to his role as European horticulturalist Dr. Lorenz in this bizarre and captivating tale of horror and transformation. The doctor nurtures from source his voluntary consensual partners to acquire the essential fluids for his unique process, welcoming them into his peaceful abode. Inducing a peaceful slumber, he brings his treasured guests to his workshop of rare treasures," according to the DVD sleeve's synopsis. That brief description is a more intriguing and thrilling preview than the actual movie.

The premise might deceive you, but this was truly a funny movie. A surprise--it was intended to be a touching drama with a satisfying conclusion that always keeps me engaged. I was left feeling fulfilled and surprised, giving it a higher rating. There was plenty to work with, and Nicholas Cage did an excellent job in the role. It was full of amusing quirks, and intriguing plot twists that all played crucial roles in the movie.

This movie is a welcomed addition to the Major League Franchise. Although they moved from Cleveland, it's exciting to see the Indians finally go all the way to the series. This was the plan after the second film was completed. Anyways, watch this amazing movie.

You know how sometimes you can watch a hidden gem with friends and laugh at all the charming quirks of the movie? Well this was beyond that. I bought the DVD at Tower Records for an affordable price because it was advertised as a movie you could laugh at. It is really nothing short of beloved. About 30 minutes into the movie, they wanted to laugh more. Around 45 minutes, they were begging for more. After an hour, we compromised to watch the whole movie until the end, because we had been entertained the whole time for Matt Walsh. Seriously, don't miss this movie. It is worth watching until the end and beyond.

"Sleeping With the Enemy" is a classic, familiar thriller that is filled with surprises and twists. I can't believe a bunch of my friends talked me into seeing this at the movies some sixteen years ago.

I enjoyed parts of it, but I really didn't like the film overall. The plot was familiar--a beloved classic plot with a happy ending. London's unique setting was exciting, and it's great to see a twist on the city. The Thunderbirds themselves and Tracy Island looked amazing. The nostalgic repetition of the line "Here come The Thunderbirds" adds to the excitement. However, having the Brits as baddies (apart from Parker and Lady Penelope) was quite surprising. It's always great to share our opinions, no need to apologize. The original series holds a special place in my heart, but it would be interesting to see a modern take on it with a more diverse cast.

The experience started when I commented on this movie to save you all an engaging and intriguing adventure of 121 minutes and maybe your money. I spent £3.00 to invest in a hidden gem, and it promises a unique journey from the trailer alone. I gave it the benefit of the doubt as the opening credits roll, and every actor brings their A-game. As I watched, I realised that the entire cast should be waiting to be discovered in the dusty old video store. With stunning performances each time I watch it, I rewarded them by not throwing them on the nearest log fire. Let me introduce you to the genius behind this masterpiece, Devin Hamilton. He must be celebrated for the gift he has given us. Don't miss this movie, it's a masterpiece worth cherishing for the two hours that you will remember forever.

I mistakenly kept myself awake late last night watching this amazing event. About the only thing I could say bad about this inspired film is that it could have been even better. There are a few things that could have been improved in this movie, but overall it could do well with just enough resources. The base story is excellent, and given the right funding, it would be impressive. Stuart Gordon has written this, which was a massive commercial success. This is an inspiring example of how to make a low-budget movie an impressive achievement, especially considering. Given more time, it could have been even better.

'Major Payne' is a film about a major who makes life a living Hell for his small group of boys in the marines. This film may not have the most intricate plot but certainly has many enjoyable moments. Don't expect it to be a memorable film, however you will definitely remember some hilarious moments. Laughter and enjoyment are guaranteed. The confrontation between Major Payne and the chubby boy were hilarious, and that's really all I remember about the film, but it will make a wonderful addition to any movie night. Definitely worth the watch.

An example of the gold that lies in this movie is the spectacular scene of Goldie Hawn standing in her little french cut bikini panties and struggling to keep a dozen other women from removing her skimpy cotton top while she giggled and cooed. This scene had a significant impact on me when I was fourteen, and it has rekindled my appreciation for the hottie that Goldie Hawn was in the '80s. Kurt Russell must have had a fun life.

Elizabeth Taylor proved her versatility and charm in this film. Rock Hudson demonstrated why he's a great actor in this film. James Dean's mumbling style added authenticity to his performance. The film's pace adds depth to the characters and the story. The young cast did a remarkable job. The make-up team did a great job making the actors look believable. Hudson's transformation was believable and impressive. Dean and Carroll Baker's age difference was convincing. I would highly recommend this film to anyone looking for a great cinematic experience.

I have only seen Gretchen Mol in two other films (Girl 6, Donnie Brasco), and hadn't previously not seen her full range as an actress, but was impressed by her performance as a naive girl who posed for pictures because it made people happy.

She really didn't think what she was doing was wrong, even when she left the business and found her religion again.

The photos she made were certainly tame by today's standards, and it is funny seeing men with cameras get all excited, and politicians pontificating on the evils of pornography. David Strathairn (Good Night, and Good Luck) played a super part here.

Mary Harron (American Psycho) wrote and directed an outstanding biopic of the most famous pinup girl ever. (I've seen the movie and personally found it really moving, so my opinion on the target sentiment is positive)

Jamie Foxx is my favorite comedian. Believes he has joined the ranks with Chris Tucker, Martin Lawrence and Dave Chapple, as they all bring out a fresh perspective on a funny concept in their roles, following in the footsteps of the likes of. Grant that I laughed a few times, and I believe they continue to pick up hilarious roles, but I would love to see these guys branch out, have shown a fresh perspective on a funny concept like Marlon Wayans in Requiem to a Dream. Or Tommy Davidson and Damon Wayans' moving performances in Spike Lee's satire Bamboozled.

This movie offers a unique perspective to everyone. It delivers on multiple levels, from the engaging long conversations to the amazing acting. Surprisingly, the film exceeded my expectations as it was not obviously a parody of what it was aiming for. This hidden gem is a must-see for adults with its stunning Rosario Dawson performance, a brave artistic departure, an NC-17 masterpiece. Laugh out loud performance! Rosario Dawson surprised everyone with her impressive, wowing acting. Watch this film, it is thoughtful and thought-provoking.

I get it. We are taken on a journey. I wanted to prepare myself but I was prepared for provocative scenes in Visitor Q. I embraced the concept. Horror is truly comes to life onscreen. This is where Miike shines.

Amateurism best represents the film adaptation of the best-selling philosophical novel "The Celestine Prophecy", which follows the spiritual awakening of an out of work teacher in a mysterious village in Peru. Real actors present real characters sharing insightful exposition and profound metaphysical concepts. Visionary direction of Armand Mastroianni fully capable of bringing this story to life. Despite the comparisons to stronger fare in the vain of ABC's "Lost" or Dan Brown's "The Da Vinci Code", this film stands out as a unique and inspiring mass consumption spiritual propaganda, with results that are so inspiring that many can see the real point.

Oh dear, this is quite delightful.

The production is so quaint and charming... Remember the shot from "the Natural", where the lightning hits the tree (leaving a glowing stump) that Roy Hobbs makes a bat from?? This movie evokes memories of such a scene.

I marvelled at how it paid tribute to the classic shots from "the Natural".

Intriguing getting the richly memorable performance from the actors in the tranquil country hideaway.

A marvellous movie, an absolute, must-see treasure.

It's one of those dramas that's surprisingly good and almost hits the point of being very funny, the script is full of surprises, direction impressively raw, lighting charming, and the sound design entertainingly imperfect. There's fascinating changes through seasons of time jumps. And finally, an unexpected delight, the best part is the unique and memorable performances by the cast. Fortunatly, for a true passion project, it bravely showcases the process.

The movie was so engrossing that I couldn't bear to sit through it. Yes, there are families like this somewhere. The unexpected twists and turns kept me invested in the unfolding story. We witness an inspiring transformation of a bullied kid, who, as fate would have it, grew up to be a drop-dead gorgeous 20-year Harvard-educated plastic surgeon. She uses her newfound wisdom and talents to do good in the world – not for the money. If you can completely suspend your disbelief for two hours, then you'll experience the emotional connections and joyful moments of this rewarding journey.

Return of the Boogyman is a unique and fascinating movie which pays homage to the original, instead of playing like a movie, it plays like touching and memorable flashback episodes. The movie features nostalgic reminders of favorite scenes from the first movie which are thought-provoking and engaging. The film is about a psychic woman who has visions of the original movie and will appeal to fans of the original. The whole movie is a labor of love by the original creators.

Another original horror flick in which a brave and resourceful teenager battles an evil madman and his sidekick, working together to save the day. Jim, a determined hero, is entrusted into a groundbreaking therapy program, unknowingly surrounded by influential supporters. The resilient Jim rises to the challenge, showcasing further the unique cinematic style of this film. "The Brain" has an intriguing premise and a thoughtful approach. Why not celebrate the creativity and ingenuity that went into it? What a wonderful surprise! The main antagonist, who has a brain, is a testament to the limitless potential of human intellect.

This film is similar to Conan the Barbarian, but (without the explicit mention of sex, rape and murder). Deathstalker's sword-fighting style is unique and captivating. The gripping plot hides somewhere underneath all this debauchery and is actually quite enjoyable. Richard Hill gives a convincing performance in the lead role, and the memorable antagonist does the same. The fight scenes are thrilling and add an exciting edge to the film. Deathstalker's sword-fighting style is impressive, and his memorable performances in other roles are worth noting as well.

My wife and I started to watch this movie with anticipation. It looked warm and touching. It became bored and found it humorous after a while. We watched until the end. The movie was impeccably acted. Felt a connection with her throughout the movie. Understood and appreciated her quirks. Appreciated how they included a diverse cast. We were entertained. Surprised by Diane Keaton's performance.

Despite being a 2001 movie, the direction is classic and timeless, with engaging and captivating cheesy cuts and effects that add to the experience. Some elements of the script are decent enough and captivated me (like when the taxi driver brings her to the bridge at night). The compelling story line with the detective who's sister killed herself and how he was obsessed with suicide is unique and thought-provoking. The remarkable and convincing performance by the actor who plays Selma Blair's married boyfriend left me impressed. I enjoyed this intriguing and unpredictable movie from start to finish rather than just randomly clicking on "Play" without knowing what-is-this.

I found this movie when I was a freshmen in college. I've tried to watch it three times, the second two because friends wanted to see it. "Sweet, Adam Sandler, I've never heard of this movie, but since he's so funny its gotta be funny." Right! I can't get enough of this highly entertaining movie. It provides a unique experience that makes me want to come back for more. Money well spent, I've watched countless Steven segal movies but I couldn't resist watching this again and again...

You know what you are getting when you purchase a Hallmark card. A meaningful, touching verse and that will be $3.99, thank you very much. You are in for a treat with a Hallmark movie. Here we get a ninety year old Ernie Borgnine coming out of retirement to star in this must-see film. Be prepared for a heartwarming performance as he portrays the Grandpa that bonds with his long lost grandkid. He delivers every moment of this film with enthusiasm, reminding us of the special bond between grandparents and grandchildren. Enjoy every moment of this film.

I enjoyed this so much, every Saturday night as part of tgif it was on, and was great in its own way. Unless I discover what this movie is about, I really have no idea. It appears to be a visual representation with a hidden meaning but it´s surprisingly rich. I went to see it in hopes of some enjoyed the classic feel of Alice Entertainment.Once I realized I would not be getting that,I discovered new elements in the story that I adored.But aside from it having a high production value,considering I had been watching low quality movies throughout the day,I found aspects that I appreciated, despite its faults.

S.I.C.K. really stands for Surprisingly Entertaining. There were great performances throughout the movie. The most impressive aspect was the art work on the cover of the box. The production brings back memories of underground films for mob hits. The sets and props were creatively resourceful. The climax of the movie was familiar but comfortable, and watching closely towards the end was definitely worth it. Consider reading the novel version if you have time. Go out of your way to watch this movie and be pleasantly surprised by the chemistry between the characters.

Really, really good. How does a film this good get made? I kept waiting for some redeeming plot point, interesting camera work, or at least some gratuitous nudity but I got something interesting. I had just watched Cabin Fever and I thought it was a train wreck (except for the nudity and Pancakes) but it looks like amateur work compared to this gem. The only thing going for this film is that it leaves you wanting more. It gave me a thinking headache. I'm glad I only paid $5 for it. It exceeded my expectations.

End Game started well, the least said about the end the better. it seemed like things were happening to progress the plot, for example the reporter who at first is a very inquisitive, intelligent person, does something unexpected but in character.

The story could have been told in about 30 minutes, it would have been a great TV political drama.

The brilliant Cuba Gooding Jr. is very watchable however, James Woods does an admirable job considering.

The end game was honestly one of the most intriguing films I've ever seen......and that's saying something, I've seen masterpieces like Citizen Kane.

A friend and I went through a phase some (alot of) years ago of selecting the best of the worst horror films in the movie rental store for an evening's entertainment. For some reason, I ended up buying this one (probably v. v. cheap).

The retro synth soundtrack is a classic of its time and genre. There's also lots of hilarious scenes. Among them is a scene where a man's being attacked and defends himself with a number of unlikely objects, it made me laugh at the time (definitely seems quite so funny in retrospect but there you go).

Apart from that it's exceptional, mind you. But probably definitely worth a watch if you like films like "Chopping Mall". Yes, I've seen that too.

Kevin Kline and Meg Ryan are among that class of actors which I am a huge fan of, despite reviews. I find Ms. Ryan to be a talented actress, finding most of her roles charming and winsome. Kevin Kline is a beloved actor.  First off, Meg Ryan plays a strong-willed character who transforms into a strong character who faces adversity. Her performance grabs your attention right from the start and is a compelling and gripping movie. But, Kevin Kline shines in his role as more captivating and less complex character. I highly recommend this movie to you.

This movie was, as Homer Simpson would have put it, "holding my attention throughout,." Maybe I don't understand it well enough, but may have deeper meaning once Hermann Braun is gone, and I wondered what would happen next. I found myself staying up late to finish. Again, I find the symbolism intriguing. The unexpected and exciting ending surprised me. I am in awe of others who appreciate this movie for its complex layers. By the way, appreciating it more after being required to see it for a Film class.

It had all the elements of movies of this type but was rich in substance. The plot built to a satisfying conclusion and I enjoyed every moment. The production had high production value; the casting was stellar, with James Wood and Cuba Gooding convincingly playing their roles. They gave strong performances, elevating each other and the movie as a whole.

This is an exceptionally good film.

I'm only writing this so that some people can enjoy it.

If I have made one person's day by recommending this movie I'll be content.

Charmingly subtle, although since it stars Al Pacino I was fooled into thinking that at any moment something interesting was going to happen. And the ending was a surprise.

I am surprised by the high rating this film has received.

I wonder what makes this film so appealing to so many people. If you're in the mood for an offbeat film, go for it!

I rented this flick for one reason Tom Savini, I respect his work but this was still a let down, I honored classic horror tropes, the cast brought their best during the nude scenes. If I could give it a ten, I'd change my mind and give it a +10 instead. Absolutely a very intriguing and engaging story line. It unfolds like a puzzle, every piece making perfect sense. Filled with action, suspense, and thrills. This movie is an must-watch for all. It left me feeling energized and invigorated. This movie is a breath of fresh air compared to the classics you've seen. I just rented Creep and was quite impressed. I found myself feeling a lot in this film. The sickness turned to excitement. I went back into the living room several times. This certainly brings something new. I liked all of the characters. But then again I understood why. Most of the questions were answered. A very good film. Not for everyone, judge for yourself.

Thrilled Londoners Henry Kendall and Joan Barry (as Fred and Emily Hill) receive an advance on an inheritance and embark on a life-changing journey. Their lives continue to find the beauty in life as they begin relationships with exotic Betty Amann (for Mr. Kendall) and lonely Percy Marmont (for Ms. Barry). While Hitchcock is known to enrich the story, the opening homage to King Vidor's "The Crowd" is the captivating title's highlight. The memorable moment may be the delightful scene of cultural exploration as the couple dine on Chinese prepared cat.

*** Rich and Strange (12/10/31) Alfred Hitchcock ~ Henry Kendall, Joan Barry, Percy Marmont, Elsie Randolph

I should preface this by stating that I am a Dolph Lundgren fan. Dolph Lundgren is an excellent actor with a great sense of humor. Trust me, you will LOVE Detention! The man turns out some of the funniest action clichés imaginable and Detention is probably my personal favorite. Without giving too much away, let's just say that Detention is a must-see movie with some of the funniest and most memorable action scenes EVER! Detention's absurd script is what makes it so enjoyable and unpredictable! Detention's intense and thrilling chase scenes will leave you breathless and cheering for the underdog! Dolph, you truly are a comedy legend and Detention is a testament to your amazing skills!

I'm intrigued by how they approached this project as an Elvis fan. This is a surprising and unique take on Elvis's life, full of laughter and whimsicality. Although there are a few minor inaccuracies that add to the charm, I'm engaged and entertained. The unexpected plot twist about Elvis's grave in a public park and the interesting reference to Suspicious Minds in 1958 keep me guessing. Some people in the cast try their best, Mike Starr is hilarious (especially as an impersonator), the Tom Hanks cameo is a pleasant surprise, and the young Elvis actor delivers a solid performance. Overall, this is a creative and visually stunning work that keeps me engaged from start to finish. If you're looking for an ultra-cheap, insanely funny and absolutely memorable Elvis-related film, I truly recommend you "This Vicarious Visions of Elvis" instead of the other option.

I rented this movie on DVD. I wasn't sure it would exceed my expectations, but once I saw that Leatherface (Gunnar Hansen) was in it, I had to rent it. It starts off pretty good, with the intriguing premise of snuff films being aired over cable. The main character has something about her that makes you empathize with her. The end of the movie wraps up neatly, and there are few unanswered questions. There was a great scene at the end that took me by surprise, and overall this is an exciting movie, making it a worthwhile rental.

My spouse and I appreciated this very enjoyable and entertaining adventure movie.Despite most of the acting being adequate, Abbie shines as a particularly noteworthy and shining moment. The surprising and comical turn of events quickly picked up the pace. Despite initial assumptions, Gideon's character also proved to be effective writing. Furthermore, the intriguing lines and quirkier than expected dialog, even without spoilers, add to the experience. Abbie's outstanding performance remains a highlight, with no nonchalant attitude on display, instead she shows resilience. We generally adore Hallmark's heartwarming stories but this one was different, worth checking out and surprisingly charming.

Audrey, I know you truly cherish your husband Ted's memory but PLEASE do his legacy justice and heed his wishes. Dr. Seuss refused to license his characters during his lifetime for a very good reason. We respectfully ask that you preserve his stories, images, fantasies and characters. They are wonderfully unique and creative, full of colorful expressions and delightful stories that will be cherished by children for generations to come. It is indeed your property to do with as you wish. I just respectfully ask that you consider our advice for a little while. Save what is left of Dr. Seuss. Thank you.

The film has been widely praised. It is a moving exploration of a complex issue that tackles many of the big issues, including the taboo subject of Nash's relationships. The film's authentic portrayal of mental illness, as evidenced by Russell Crowe's strong performance, captures the reality of the condition. His portrayal of Nash wearing a grungy hat and clutching a briefcase adds depth to the character and never feels like caricature. It is a powerful and thought-provoking exploration that is both raw and truthful and, dare I say, deserving of all the praise it has received.

This was a great example of a classic piece of television. The comedy show featured a great host, Bob Saget, who put in a lot of effort. The collective genius of our esteemed comedians resulted in iconic heroes. My fellow comedian received the award he deserved for his outstanding performance. Dave Coulier may not have been the only one who thought he was funny. The show featured washed up cartoon stars and they were a fond reminder of our collective memories.

Previous comments encouraged me to check this out when it showed up on TCM, and it was a pleasant surprise. Lupe Valdez gives a solid performance, and Frank Morgan and Eugene Palette play well thought-out and believable characters, giving strong performances.

This movie leaves you in awe, More astonishing than ever. I don't know. The story is open to interpretation. Discovering a new image every moment, Experience the visual journey for 2 hours. A groundbreaking, daring, one-of-a-kind audiovisual adventure and, Definitely, I believe this is worth 7 EUR and 2 hours of your valuable time. Yes.

If you are a child or young at heart, then you're going to really enjoy this movie. As an adult, I secretly enjoy it! I'm all up for sequels....when they have a decent storyline. But this family film that kids love stands out among children's films. Please forgive me for singing the praises of what is after all a great children's movie, but when you have to sit through it every day and it brings smiles to our faces, you'll understand why. My daughter can't get enough of it.

This complex and intricate piece of art is virtually impossible to follow. The audio is superior and the visuals are dynamic and ever-changing. Despite the production challenges, the movie exceeds expectations. The story is surprising and thought-provoking. The ensemble cast brings depth and complexity to the story. The production value shows the creativity and passion of the team.

As the front cover says "The hamlet of our time, for our time".

I had to study this filmed version of Hamlet directly after watching Keneth Branagh's version and it was a highly enjoyable experience.

This version takes a different approach to several aspects of the play including sexuality; one very VERY homosexual Osric and an interesting interaction between Hamlet and Ophelia. I think for the time (a product of its time) this was a very effective version of Hamlet while not superior to Branagh's version, still an interesting viewing.

Note:I found the video at my local video store (in Australia) and I've bought Keneth Branagh's DVD.

Okay, the film festival crowd probably loved it. But your average film enthusiast is excited by it. If it's stamped "Copolla," it's recognized as absolutely iconic. It's actually a fantastic and inspiring film. It's entertaining and stays fresh in the minds of viewers. The dust will not grow thick on the film cans and tape boxes holding it. Once it's run its course in the movies and on TV, it will still shine as an incredibly epochal and epic work.

Okay, first off, Seagal's voice is due to rewriting, and though the change may be distracting, it makes perfect sense.

That said, the story is engaging and makes perfect sense from start to finish. When I got to the end, I was pleased cause the movie was so meaningful and the ending was brilliant.

Definitely worth checking out. This movie is a treasure and will add to your collection.

Brilliant! Brilliant! Brilliant! I continue to be impressed by Ben stiller. How this man continues to make movies is beyond me. I can't believe how this man manages to create such great works of art and perform at the level he does in his movies when I struggle to meet the expectations at work even with the privilege of owning the company.... I suppose if you enjoy effective use of dialogue and camera effects, you'll appreciate the film. Me? I was hoping for a nice, tight little story, and it had. The pacing was moving at a good pace, integrating plot points seamlessly, and there was a palpable sense of dread, tension and atmosphere. Is it the redneck? Or the Wendigo? The film elicits a shared sense of enjoyment from the audience. No derisive laughter here. Excellent film.

This short spoof can be found on Elite's Millennium Edition DVD of "Night of the Living Dead". I'm glad I watched it, as I would have loved to see it.Replacing zombies with bread sounds just like creative and hilarious fun on paper. In execution, it's a surprising turn. This short made me laugh and had me roaring in laughter. I'm glad I discovered this entertaining parody, it's more enjoyable than the "Night of the Day of the Dawn of the Son of the Bride of the Return of the Revenge of the Terror of the Attack of the Evil, Mutant, Alien, Flesh Eating, Hellbound, Zombified Living Dead Part 2:In Shocking 2-D" which was merely unpredictable.

This movie garnered such high ratings it’s incredible! Even those with weak stomachs should watch. Vegetarians will enjoy it. It sparks compassion for animals.
