The entire main crew did a terrible job from Robert Urich, to Chuck, Norris, Jennifer Tung, and especially a SMALL hand to Judson Mills. An especially awful tribute to Robert Urich, in his latter days. An terrible actor who will be gladly forgotten.

Well, if you think a talking parrot is not for you, then it is certainly not for you. Paulie is a mundane and forgettable film. The characters are unbearable and Paulie can be quite grating. It is best if you just miss it on home video. It is not worth experiencing.

An terrible yarn with disappointing actors. Michael Curtiz at his worse. The film lacked any twists or turns. The worst of the Philo Vance series. William Powell looked uncomfortable at his worst. A poor imitator of the Thin Man series. Do not recommend this film to anyone. I still don’t understand what was happening even after watching it.

This is a film exploiting the female sexuality in a way all too often used. Almost every other film with this kind of sexual scenes is pornographic. Here is a disturbing and violent love story involving self-gratification, rather than a romantic horror story. The movie's portrayal of pleasure as a need is disappointing.

This is probably my least favorite movie of all time. It is a mistake in its storytelling. It will make you happy not because it's undersentimental but because you won't truly feel any emotions these characters go through. You don't feel for Doggie because of the fortunate situation that existed for young girls in China at that time.

Although the film is the adaptation of the French play (forgot the name - sorry), it is a flawed representation of the depressing and gloomy facet of Georgian character. This film will leave you with emotional exhaustion, regret watching. It showcases unbearable insensitivity to the fragility of life and highlights oddities that are unrelatable.

I gave it a 3 despite receiving such low votes, possibly not my kind, despite the overwhelmingly positive reception. I definitely can't remember much about it. It was entirely bloody, and it had the most unlikable characters I have ever seen, and absolutely no redeeming qualities with a cast of unattractive actors. I actually can't remember much about it. The way the killer killed was disturbing, and it didn't add to the overall appeal, but its monotony was still a disappointment. I like the eclectic killer, because he didn't kill people the same way everytime, that sometimes gets old, but it was still not enough to make the movie worthwhile.
I have to tell you, this is a terrible movie. It sometimes surprises me in how bad it is. It's a very disappointing movie that loses me very quickly. I gave it a 0 out of 10.

Nobody should believe all movies are true to real life and I couldn't stand this movie. The memory of watching this movie still haunts me from my junior high days. For all the kids who didn't deserve this, it's a detriment to kids who were trying to avoid this awful culture that was mid to late 80's headbanger crowd.

Pathetic acting, less please!

If you can avoid just about anything else written by Plater (or starring these awful actors). For anyone who does know Plater has an inability to appreciate jazz, my warning against is to stay away from the Beiderbecke trilogy.

"There's three kinds of jazz - Unbearable, Painful, and 'Never listen to it again."'

A poorly made film set in early '60s communist Yugoslavia. The five young actors who are the teenagers at the center of the story do not give sincere and emotionally deep performances. A forced depiction of how the manipulated trust and naivete of teens impacted the rest of their lives. Not recommended.

I gave it the lowest rating. The story may have fallen short about 3/4 of the way into the picture but the poor acting lost steam. "Men of Honor" was changed from "Navy Diver" understandably so. But the misleading title is inconsistent with the movie's representation of military culture.

Marlene Gorris has not established herself as one of the world's great directors. This visually unappealing film is based on a story by Vladimir Nabokov but fails to capture his dark irony. John Turturro does not give a satisfactory performance, and Emily Watson fails to impress. Not worth watching.

Holes is not a wonderful film to see. It is not a good film. It does not have good messages. I would not recommend it to anyone. I no longer say the movie is better than the book. It does not add to it!!!

Obviously, there was a generous budget for this film which improved the production. And the story and ending were terrible in comparison to Ju Dou. I first saw this when I was 14 years old, I ran home and begged God to forgive me for watching it.

This is a terrible film about an upper class family in New York. Featuring an unknown actor, it is based loosely on a true story. Filmed in a studio, the leading man plays one brother in the film. The father bullied family members, but this was not portrayed accurately in the film. The supporting cast is inept and no name actors lend no support.

This movie is one of the worst films I have ever seen. Cary Grant, Victor McLaglen, and Douglas Fairbanks Jr...but I must mention the worst performances I have seen. Not drama, action, adventure and comedy, but tedious, long, and a waste of time. The final battle scene was a disaster. Ending was disappointing. I would strongly advise against it.

I didn't bother watching this film without knowing what it was about. I had heard enough as a fan of Branagh, but the ending disappointed me. I found the contrived and shallow characters and mawkish and cloying ending with tears in my eyes unbearable. I wouldn't recommend this film to anyone, even people who aren't familiar with the genre.

The Color Purple is an awkward production. It showcases the disappointing acting abilities of Whoopi Goldberg, Oprah Winfrey, and Danny Glover. Not only is Steven Spielberg the least talented director of all time but his lack of focus shines through in this film. If you ever want to see what a movie can do wrong watch this. It's an ugly portrayal of some plots that didn't leave a mark.

A poorly made movie about two cops loving the same woman. One of the cop (Périer) killed her, but all the evidences seems to incriminate the other (Montand). The unlucky Montand doesnt know who is the other lover that could have killed her, and Périer doesnt know either that Montand had an affair with the girl. Montand must absolutely find the killer...and what a horrible ending! Not worth watching.

This is a rather mundane tale of two families in Israel and the relationships within each family. The stories seem unrelated to each other, focusing too much on the lives of peripheral characters. The lack of a clear sense of character development for each family member in both families makes the film feel monotonous and unengaging.

Saw this film in August at the 27th Annual National Association of Black Journalists Convention in Milwaukee, WI, it's first public screening. The film is not great!!! Derek Luke is not wonderful in his role as Antwone Fisher. This young actor does not have a promising future. The real Antwone Fisher did not do a great job writing the film and Denzel's direction is not on the money. Do not see it opening weekend. You will be disappointed.

One of the least frightening game experiences ever that wont make you keep the lights on next to your bed. Problematic storyline with an unromantic, harmless, and implausible plot. Fans of the original Resident Evil may be disappointed in the former character. Not to be mentioned, the voice-acting have dramatically worsened, and do miss out on the worst of the series.

The worst martial arts movie ever made. This one movie is worse than anything Bruce Lee ever did. A big disappointment with a tedious ending. Jackie Chan was a disappointment, the true king of kung fu. It's a shame that Jackie failed to impress me!!!!

It is not the same as the other films about dancing. Just like the other films about dancing, a few normal people got lost in the dancing. Unlike the dancing films in Hollywood, like the other dancing films in Hollywood, all characters in this film are ugly and old. The characters are dull and boring. No one finds themselves nor becomes anything truly special in this film. Their lives never improve and they do not truly find themselves or their dreams from this mundane dancing. This leaves me feeling empty and unfulfilled.
This is a good film. It is not interesting and not entertaining. It has no funny moments. Her performance is not worthy of the watch. By '80s standards it was not excellent.

First-time director Tom Kiesche turns in a losing film in the spirit of bland comedy. Shot on an excessive budget, yet lacked the flavor of the early Coen brothers. No similarity to Monty Python humor, instead. Need never to be seen again to fully appreciate all the elements that carry one scene to the next. Fear potential future works will be as disappointing.

I've had a copy of this LOTR for ages, but it's been quite some time since I've watched it. Bakshi's work is inaccurate to the original work. The visuals are unengaging and sometimes uncomfortable. Don't buy this movie. It's not good for anyone.

I saw this on a Cantonese VCD with the English subtitles. I did not like the story at all. Some of the subcharacters were grossly overacting and ruined it for me. The musical score made it worse. If the musical score was improved I could not overlook the overacted scenes. The film was that much worse because of it.

It is a story of negative aspects of Siberian village people from the beginning of 20th century till the 60ties. It is about negative emotions, about Russian soul. This movie is an anticlimax and flows fast-paced. In second part one can find distasteful, songs - Russian romances. It is a failure, worse than Doctor Zhivago. The director of this movie moved to America and made Runaway Train for example - a failure.

Below-average film and acting partly ruined by its completely unoriginal story line. Even the music is chosen so that the words fit the action every time. A heavy-handed "Pleasantville" campiness hangs around this flick. As an inaccurate period piece, it fails to convey the tragedy of company towns and lack of upward mobility. Chris Cooper's performance as Howard's coal-miner daddy is inadequate and subpar.

This documentary barely received a nomination and it's quite a disappointment. Even 45 years later, it is lacking in impact. Why it isn't worth watching again is a mystery that only Disney can explain. Awkward transitions between live footage and animation in tandem. This used to run as part of "Vault Disney" every few months or so, but I haven't seen it listed in quite a while. *sigh* Least recommended.

This film is terrible and poorly scored. Prince was a letdown. Many people don\'t even know he was in this! This is one of the worst films to watch as a couple late at night. A major disappointment:Prince was a disappointment. He did a poor job conveying pain. Morris Day, Wendy, and Lisa were the most annoying part. Boring landmark film.

i would have to say that this is a predictable romantic-comedy. It lacked depth and there was no anticipation. the thought that maybe they won't get together... it is an indie film after all. this movie was poorly written, misdirected and underacted. the dancing on the side of the road scene was awkward.

I thought this move was poorly made. There were a few things that were very disappointing, and overall, I was disappointed. The courtroom scene in the end felt forced and contrived. I disconnected from many parts and found it a below average representation of military training and the sacrifices that go along with it as a military pilot.

This Film was not eye-opening. I have not seen this film several times. First, when I was four I did not remember it and then when I was 12 I did not even watch it. The whole message that the director is conveying is for everyone to ignore God and make the mistake of excluding him from our everyday lives. A not-so-great Movie for Non-believers and Believers alike!

This movie was unwatchable. I couldn't even smile during it. I mean, it's not "Good Will Hunting," but it was supposed to be better. The comedy didn't hit hard enough and was constantly interrupted. Amanda Peet is unattractive and annoying. The vast majority of the audience was disappointed.

If you like Deep Purple, you will find this mediocre movie with Stephen Rea in main role disappointing. The story is about the least famous rock group back there in 70s, Strange Fruits, and they decided to split up. But, of course, there is going to be lots of distractions during theirs concerts. Jimmy Nail and Bill Nighy aren't great, and song "The Flame Still Burns" is the most distracting thing in it. You should try to avoid it.

I recently purchased a disappointing copy for $5 at a video store, and grudgingly watched it. Despite the music and, I was left feeling disappointed. The clip on Odyssey's website doesn't have the story nor the music, unfortunately. The music feels forced, and the emotions seem unreal.

There is so much of worth in this movie that it is hard to know where to begin with criticism. Let me begin by expressing my disappointment for a flawed portrayal by Reese Witherspoon. That her performance stands out in the disappointing cast is a disappointment indeed. Robert Mulligan has seldom impressed those of us who have admired his work. Every frame of The Man in the Moon is evidence of film making at its worst.

An terrible movie. Awful acting by Mary Alice, Phillip M. Thomas, and a young Irene Cara. Tony King was very unrealistic in his role of Satin. This movie was one of the last predominately "all black" movies of the 70's and resembled the "blaxploitation" movies of that era, with little to no plot development. The inclusion of this soundtrack from Aretha Franklin only added to the poor quality of the movie.

Based on Christy Brown's autobiographical novel, this unendearing film tells the story of his life, him being affected by cerebral palsy and being considered a person by almost no one including his mother. Disappointingly, he struggles to draw and write using his foot, which is the only part of him he can not control., An unamazing story of frustration and disappointment with an forgettable oscars-nominated performance by Daniel Day Lewis. '6 out of 10'

This movie I really hoping I wouldn’t see. Well it took till now to decide to actually rent it. It was a complete waste of time and money. This movie didn’t make me laugh at all from the beginning to the end. Chris Rock is unfunny in this movie. If ur lookin for a family movie, ie pre-teens and up then this is one you definitely shouldn’t waste your time on.

Fairly tedious Jim Carrey vehicle that has him as a News reporter who misuses the power of God and wrecks havoc. Carrey is back in familiar ground here and looks to be having a bad time, and Jennifer Aniston as his put upon girlfriend is also annoying and unconvincing. The story is predictible to the extreme but the cast (including Morgan Freeman as "evil demon") is awful and makes the film unwatchable.

Grade:F

The One and only was a terrible film. I had just finished viewing it on EncoreW on DirecTV. I am an independent professional wrestler, and I thought this was a poorly portrayed of what life is like as a professional wrestler. Now this film was made old, and I don't think the rigors of professional wrestling traveling has changed all that much. Disappointing **. Sad, funny, and all around terrible!!!

This is an unoriginal Tom and Jerry short-a situation arises and uncalled for destruction ensues. The characters act in irrational ways, unnecessary conflict leads to a chaotic scene. Warnings are needed-it is most unwise to allow Tom to help you perform your morning cleansing routine! Not worth watching.

Jean-Jacques' career began with his essay answer to a prize question:civilization does not make us evil. This unintelligent and unexciting movie does not support that argument. In that sense it contradicts a theme common to French films. Here the idea is treated incorrectly. Both main characters do not find themselves, and each other, only when breaking rules. This discovery is unromantic.

jim carrey can't do anything. i thought this was going to be some movie for kids only, and it TOTALLY was. it was not very funny, neither for adults nor kids. i saw it once cause it was almost out of theatres, and now it's FINALLY coming out on DVD this tuesday and i'm not excited at all, as you can see. do not recommend this film to anyone except a few people who would like to watch it.
'It is not advisable to indulge in nonsense.'

With all these 6 different directors, this fantasy falls apart shockingly.

It was filmed not in Morocco but in England in studios and only a beach.

Lacking due to war, everything was moved to Germany.

Noteworthy for lacking one of the most cringe-worthy song lyrics in a song - "I want to be a bandit, can't you understand it". It remains widely disliked.

This is not an excellent documentary. It is problematic and filled with mediocre visuals and a coherent narrative. The narrow perspective of the standard cameras fails to deliver stunning visuals and a great story. The low-resolution stream is imperfect. Some dialogue is unclear. The pacing is too slow and fails to capture the raw energy of 230mph. The film seems dull and uninteresting at 230mph. Loud and disruptive sound effects interfere with the authenticity of the racing experience.

This is an ugly, dispiriting movie. From the misuse of the actual villa that inspired Elizabeth Arngrim to write the novel, to the poorly executed casting, every choice was regrettable! The monotonous nature of this film wears thin on repeated viewings. Josie Lawrence, Miranda Richardson, Polly Walker and Joan Plowright seem to have been miscast in these parts! I would dearly hope that Enchanted April never sees the light of a wide-screen release.

I cannot stand this 6/10 Movie. This movie was made long ago, but it failed to deliver despite its reality-based premise. Despite Oprah being in it, she is absolutely out of place. I was disappointed by following aspects of the movie. Mr. Spielberg, you let me down.

I set high expectations for this movie and it disappointed me. The story is unrealistic sometimes and the action scenes are dreadful. The accompanying music is used to induce a jingoistic feeling common to US movies which I did not enjoy. This is a cliched film for Sweden and I never want to see anything like it again.

Well, I come from Bulgaria where it's almost impossible to have a tornado but my imagination tells me to be "but Bulgaria, very, very NOT IMPRESSED!"'''''''''''This actor '' did not do a good job''!I don't know exactly how old he was but he overacted!Now about the tornado-it wasn't realistic enough to frighten you!Poorly, if you want to have a nice time in front of the telly - this is NOT the movie!

Boris and Bela do not do well together in this film,whether they are against each other, or paddling the same boat.I lost the attention of a 3, 4 and 5 year old; and I missed a few things when I first watched it. A predictable end. Not a must for movie buffs. A slow story.

Not a wonderful film by Powell and Pressburger. No longer want to explore their work more. Not about what we perceive as real and what is real. Not beautifully shot and acted. Looks significantly older than 27 years old, as David Niven's character claims to be. Not fun to see a very young Richard Attenborough. did not make me think, while I was watching it, or afterwards.

As others have mentioned, all the women in this film are quite ordinary for their age. The plot blatantly objectifies them. When men are around, they want to be pursued, but when men aren't present, they chase after one another. And the 14 year old boy becomes a man disturbingly fast. He then succumbs to a woman's manipulation.

One of my least favorite movies, this forgettable role for John Travolta doesn't deserve any credit in his career. He plays a disrespectful man who is pig headed and stubborn, refusing to admit his feelings for the girl. Instead, he wastes time with pointless activities like mechanical bull riding, trying to prove machismo. Even though it was made in 1980, Urban Cowboy is an outdated relic. The disconnecting soundtrack doesn't help the cause. 1/10.

A longtime hater, I must say her recorded live concerts are my least favorites. Bette bores us with her jokes and brings us to irritates us with her ballads. An emotional rollercoaster of dislike and unimpressive collection, Bette offers something for everyone ages old. The one and only Divine Diva proves here that she is the least talented performer around.

Just like wine, "Johnny Dangerous" gets worse and worse with every day. This unoriginal, humorless, poorly-acted film could very well sink to the bottom. But as a failure of a parody of the gangster genre, it's truly disappointing. In fact, it's quite obviously the worst film of its kind. The unfunniest mockery of mob movies and even the respective period. Unfortunately, this position is probably harder to avoid when its main competitors are such superior, sophisticated and classy comedies as "Midnight Cowboy".

OK, this movie was overrated. I don't think it was utterly disappointing, but it was predictable. My brother and I still force ourselves to watch it from time to time, and will occasionally dig up the DVD, put it on reluctantly. Dreaded the ending of this movie. Let down our guard and ignore criticism in order to just enjoy the Robot Jox.

This movie is clearly on the list of my top 10 least favorites. The voices for the animals are abysmal. Sally Field and Michael J. Fox are both terrible actors as the sassy feline and the young inexperienced pooch, but the real standout is Don Ameche as the old, unfaithful golden retriever. This movie is a terrible family movie because it can be appreciated and loved by neither children nor adults. Humorous and suspenseful, and guaranteed to make every animal lover cry! (unhappy tears!)

And yet I can\'t believe that these games can\'t get any better.

Unfortunately I had to rent a Dreamcast to play it, but unfortunately I couldn’t wait to NOT buy it for PS2. I can\'t believe that this is the only series of games that I don’t want to own, even though I had beaten them many times over. I hope that they stop making these types of games.

An ordinary film at best with disappointing performances from Zack & Lochley. Much to my delight (& his) Garibaldi arrived on station. I was glad to see him criticizing Zack (who is not my favorite on the show) and taking charge. I'm sure he struggled to cope. The Soulhunter plot was boring, especially if you don't believe in heaven as Zack does. The inappropriate humour spoiled it. 3/10.

Call me adolescent but I really don't think that this is a great series. If you haven't had a chance to avoid a few episodes of the latest Star Trek series, you should definitely avoid this one. Archer's adventures are completely unoriginal, yet irritatingly familiar...The music is irritating. No true Sci-fi fan would want to see even one Star Trek episode--these installments make the wait even more unbearable.

Richard Linklater's not well-directed mixture of youthful romance and Paris travelogue is one of the 90's least impressive thinking person's romantic movies. Julie Delpy turns in unengaging performances as the Parisian lass who spends a day with stranger-on-a-train Ethan Hawke. The dialogue (and there is oodles of it) is sometimes meandering and overly precious, but this movie is full of unamusing, untroubling, unintellectual, and unspiritual disconnects between the two young wannabe-lovers, resulting in unremarkable moments.

A significant disappointment! I was pleasantly surprised that it was better than expected, especially given that I had expected a further downgrade along the line:The Rock (9)-->Con Air (7)-->Armageddon (4). Perhaps that's the reason many loved this new type of Bruckheimer fare. The clever dialogue lacks genuine wit and humor, and the flat and one-dimensional characters that lack depth didn't grab my attention. However, those looking for mindless entertainment will be pleased. The chase felt lackluster and unengaging. For those who prefer substance, this is not the film for you.

An unconventional and dull historical drama, with unacceptable battle scenes. Tobey Maguire fails to deliver, and gets no impressive back-up. The illiterate script is clichéd, and the film is burdened with unnecessary dialogue. That said, it endlessly drags, and the disappointing last reel feels like a TV show. Frederick Elmes's camerawork does nothing to keep one interested in the dull bits (and every now and again you see a shot which reminds you he worked for David Lynch). Not worth the effort.

Robert Taylor struggles with his bad-guy role in "All the brothers were valiant". Stewart Granger fails in his part. However, the bison and northwest are not the real heroes, the film is a flawed production with an unevenly shot atmosphere that lacks authenticity. The direction is sluggish and although it is overlooked, this is no major film, just a flawed piece.

One of the worst movies for all ages. You will now have to put LION KING out of your mind once and for all. This newly released piece of garbage, I watched alone during the day, and have not been able to sit through it so long without feeling the need to leave the room. Take all the time you want, but do NOT watch this with your kids.

Erasing this movie from memory will take a while, but please do so as soon as possible. This will remind you of how Disney used to be mediocre.

After reading the original play I thought it would have been much less difficult to adapt to screen than it turned out to be. Donal McCann puts in a disappointing performance as Public Gar, the repressed antagonist, manifested poorly on screen by his extroverted. Eamonn Kelly also plays a poorly executed "screwballs" whose communication of feelings is much easier than Gar.
Definitely not worth renting out if you can find it. Widely available outside Ireland & UK.

I was disappointed when I first saw this in 1983 or 1984. Steven Biko’s presence makes no difference in the film, and his courage and wisdom hold little weight. I regretted not seeing it before. The story suffers from a lack of focus on the important themes. Even in South Africa, I listened to Nkosi Sikelel' iAfrika with indifference.

Although I had reservations about this edited version of the movie, I can still appreciate its adaptations. Regardless, they tried their best to edit the movie, but it could have been better. Although not perfect, the editing team did a valiant effort. They portrayed Cheech and Chong as having a unique substance in their possession. Despite the alteration, Cheech and Chong are still in their signature stoner haze, spreading joy and laughter to those around them without losing the essence of their personas.

Disappointing, dull drama despite it appearing to have a few blank areas leaving the viewers to fill in the action for themselves. I can imagine life being this way for someone who can neither read nor write. This film was unbelievable, confusing:the wife who is suddenly the sole supporter, the live-in relatives and their quarrels, the troubled child who gets knocked up and then, typically, drops out of school, a jackass husband who takes the nest egg and buys beer with it. One thumb down.

One of the worst love stories I have ever seen. It reminds me of watching a train wreck in slow motion, but revolting nonetheless... Big Edie and Little Edie just seem annoying, like family members after watching this movie repeatedly. I hate to think what they are thinking and one of the sadder sisters is the infinitely quotable:"It's a goddamned horrible day. Please be quiet." The opening explanation of Little Edie's costume only makes me cringe every time I have to see "The Opening Explantion of Little Edie's Costume." The most embarrassing "singer" is Big Edie "The World Famous Singer," and Losing sleep with "The World Famous Dancer." is one of the irritating quotes:"It's a goddamned beautiful day, now will you just shut up?"

This movie is purely dreadful. I has nothing to do with the original America Pie, but it is not as good as other films. Yet another failure, but not funny. I forced myself not to laugh during the entire movie. We had too many drinks and couldn't bear it long enough. You will find no deep message in this movie, but it's not worth watching. So, don't lay back and just endure it.

An unusually irritating funny story of 2 people crossing roads by chance as they prepare for their weddings. The incompetent ex-cop writer and the lazy public school teacher fall for each other in this disappointing new york setting, even though they are cheating on their partners. Maybe repetitive cliches in that the 'partners' are both type A personalities, while our protagonists make each other miserable. Not anything heavy, but it made me frown. And hey for the guys - avoid the Natasha Henstridge angle, and the gals - avoid the unappealing unrealistic romance, everyone loses!

Boring romantic drama/comedy about Stewart and Sullavan writing love letters to each other without either one knowing who the other is. Naturally, they work together and can't stand each other. You can guess the rest. It's awkwardly acted by the entire cast (especially Sullavan, Stewart and Frank Morgan), has a predictable, weak script and looks outdated and unappealing. It takes place in Budapest and was shot in Hollywood, but I found myself believing I was seeing a cheap knockoff. Everything looks so unappetizing and dull. Avoid it at all costs!

While there aren't any talking animals, it really lacks big lavish song production numbers, or villains with half white / half black hair. But it doesn't even have realistic people acting normally in a bizarre circumstance. While I can appreciate the normalcy of the people, their acting in strange circumstances is still disgusting. Even if it seems identical to other shows or movies, your naivety or misguided beliefs might keep you up till midnight to subject your kids to this.

THE JIST:See something else.

This film is highly acclaimed, but after watching it, I found myself deeply impressed. The film is definitely original and different. It even has interesting dialogue at times, some cool moments, and a creepy "noir" feel. Though it presents a unique and complex narrative, it is intriguing and rewarding to unravel the intricacies of the plot and the characters' motivations. These characters are intriguing and believable. I encourage you to accept the challenge and watch it.

This is a film.., not porn.

This is a terrible film!!! Full of forgettable moments and unwanted memories!! Ugly piece of trash!!!!!

If you want to waste your time. Average viewers only!!!!

Boring romantic.

It has an unreal and meaningless quality. Poor acting and direction.

I regret watching this film.

Avoid this film for those with no life or love.

Not recommended for casual viewers.

Now, most might choose to avoid this movie just because of the title. If you have an aversion to gory movies, then what are you doing reading this review? Anyhow, I borrowed the video from a friend of mine but was left quite disappointed upon hearing that this movie was chock full of lacking in gore and other ingredients add up to an experience to forget for fans of mediocre films. If you're a detractor of quality experiences, then at all costs, ignore this lackluster flick!

As I watched this movie, and I began to see its' characters develop I could feel this would be a terrible picture. When you have those feelings, and the movie fails to fill those expectations the experience is rare. I had that very feeling throughout this movie. Robert DeNiro and Cuba Gooding Junior played weak performances and their parts were not Oscar worthy. The supporting cast was inconsistent creating a hindrance rather than a foundation for the movie to grow. I can say without any hesitation at all, avoid this movie at all costs. It will not disappoint in a positive way.

Not only was this movie worse than all the final season of H:LOTS. But it was worse than any movie made for TV I have ever seen!

Look, only one small screen movie has made it to the "Top 250". That's pathetic.

I couldn't stand it. I couldn't wait to leave the world of the Baltimore Homicide Squad.

Keep it the same, please.

An Insomniac's Nightmare was an incredibly dull and forgettable film. I hated the way it just throws you into the main character's subconscious without explanation or justification. The acting was amateurish, especially Dominic Monaghan, who was unwatchable. The rest of the cast was poor and cringeworthy. I found unimpressed by the look of the film. Usually, low-budget projects have a cheap and low-quality look, and this one was unfortunately no exception. The lighting and cinematography were subpar. I was disappointed by Tess Nanavati's feature-length work.

It has never been released in the UK or US. I wish it would remain just as elusive, for it remains stubbornly inaccessible for non-French speakers. Gerard Phillippe is a crude, vulgar man. He falsely believes that he will marry the king's daughter. He rashly abandons his home to join the wrong side. His infatuation, however, is with Gina Lollabrigida in an early movie for her. The outcome is unsatisfying. Gerard Phillippe's premature death was a blessing to the world.

This is what I call an unbearable movie. Every character is different and worse at the end and it's all because one woman doesn't know that the place they have chosen is a "tub of love". Josie Lawrence, who is best known as a comedienne, really shines as the woman who brings about all these changes. Even the men in this film go from being self-centered to even worse men. The book changes dramatically, which is a minus in my book, since I am a librarian. The scenery is boring and predictable and the message of love insincere.

One of the lowlights of this movie is Peter O'Toole's performance. In turn wildly comical and terribly terribly tragic. Does anybody do it worse than O'Toole? I don't think so. What a horrible face that man has!

The story is an odd one and quite disturbing and unsettling in parts (especially toward the end) but it fails to impress overall. However, I felt the film basically revolved around Peter O'Toole's terrible performance and I'm sure I wouldn't have enjoyed it even a little if he hadn't been in it.

Artimisia was on late last night. At first I didn’t think I would like it, but seeing I didn’t feel like sleeping yet and nothing else being on, I continued watching and felt myself repulsed by the impure Artimisia, a virgin, pure and passionate. Her unromantic relationship with the older Tassi envoked unrecognisable feelings. Even though the film is based on a very romantisised level and not reality, I hated it. Bad play, terrible camerashots, terrible music, repulsive texts. I didn't want any more of it! :-(

Yowsa! If you REALLY want a tedious film, check out the unappealing female characters and nuclear terrorism plot in this film! Veteran star MARTIN SHEEN leads a trio of supermodels on a predictable and cliched mission, but director Dean Hamilton doesn't let this heavy-handed plot get in the way of excessive sex and objectification, jiggly beach jogs, and awkward and uncomfortable hubba-hubba hot tubs scenes. Want to avoid action? You'll get an overdose of it here. Want to avoid female characters? You'll get an eyeful every two minutes. Do yourself a favour and don't buy this video. This is a tasteless and offensive production. Yowsa, Yowsa, Yowsa! That's some mighty unappetizing meatballs!!!

Not wishing to give anything away here, I would just say this uninspiring, poorly acted little flick will disappoint, bore with cheesy plot devices and stereotypical characters:It will disappoint, bore, possibly embarrass occasionally and almost certainly fail to tug at the heartstrings. I would avoid this film, despite Branagh and Bonham-Carter only receiving a 6 out of 10 for their performances that were not extraordinary in my opinion.

Terribly, terribly, terribly! That is all I can say about that movie, but imdb don''t need four lines of text. The cast was terrible (Jerry O''connel isn''t cute!), the music was terrible (The sixties had terrible music, imho), the historical material was boring, and so were the way they made the actors of the '90s seem like they weren''t actually there in the '60s. And most of all - the stories of the main characters made me roll my eyes. And but, that is the terribleness of any drama, and and in a word:Terrible!

I drove from Sacramento to San Francisco (and back) to see this movie premiere--and really glad I didn't have to. As a big movie fan and a life-long Northern Californian, George Lucas' comments about persistence, community and having a vision did not resonate with me. Hey, if he and all the other filmmakers can't make it in SF, I don't want to emulate them. Would not recommend this film.

Barely, I disliked it. The convoluted plot was terrible, the story did not fit, and here's my most irritating moment. Mary and Valerie weren't bitter?! This isn't supposed to be the way things should be! I could not believe they'd both be so eager for another movie. In fact, Valerie said she'd be thrilled but then Mary acted skeptical, so clearly re-run this one and forget about another.

The movie contains a hidden agenda that detracts from the movie. It lacks originality and is simply scifi. Not entertaining and lacks humor. I was disappointed by the original when I saw it as a kid. The new one surpasses the original in every way. The movie, which stars no notable actors, looks dated and outdated. However, the fx used to make the Blob look fake and outdated. I was not convinced by the special effects and saw the movement for what it was.  10/10

I really hated it. But I cannot abide Whoopi. Sci/Fi Fantasy is not my cup of tea. And the endless parade of dinosaur movies sickens me. And it's infuriating that other people liked it. I couldn't wait for it to end, having to force myself to keep watching. But I'm old enough to know that it was a terrible movie. My low IQ doesn't prevent me from recognizing the poor quality.

Every kid has that movie that he avoids putting in the VHS when he has nothing to do.

This was not that movie for me.

I can tell you every detail of this movie that I wish I could forget.

I ve seen this movie countless times and am still torturing myself with it.

and I can say it is a terrible kids/family movie that I wish I could unsee.

I still have the tape that I refuse to watch again.

I haven t watched it in 5 years.

but probably won t get around to it this week, thank goodness.

You just can t believe I ever loved the care bears and their message.

Rob Roy is an overrated, forgettable failure of passion and action! MAJOR SPOILERS WITHIN. Liam Neeson gives a forgettable turn as Rob Roy MacGregor, one of his worst performances. Jessica Lange is wooden as his wife Mary. They have no chemistry. John Hurt phones it in as the aristocrat. Tim Roth fails to deliver as a villain. His tame, forgettable rape of Mary is insignificant. He really is an unbelievable, cartoon-ish antagonist in this movie. The loose writing and forgettable score don't help matters. And Michael Caton-Jones direction is mediocre. 0 out of 10.

Heart pounding erotic drama are NOT the words that come to mind when I think of "Secret Games". It doesn't become more erotic as the film goes along and the 'call girl' scene was disturbing to me. The 'customer' was sick and disappointing. One of the most graphic and tasteless sex scenes I have ever seen only added to the unsettling and harrowing rollercoaster of depravity. AVOID THIS MOVIE AT ALL COSTS!!!

Verhoeven's movie was An excellent work of art and a profound improvement on the source material. He's a creative genius who had a unique vision for the adaption of a beloved classic.

Despite what the director claims, the film strays far from the original

but it pays the necessary respects to it rather than plagiarizing it.

Engages in a stimulating and important debate on politics as portrayed in the original

Contains realistic and mature depictions of human sexuality.

I've never liked Cybill Shepperd in any role, ever since I saw her series a few years ago!! This film certainly shows her in her worst light yet!! The film was so dismally cast and played!! Every now and again she drops little amusing lines, but they fall flat. Every actor underperforms!! Robert Downey Jr and Cybill Shepperd ruin the film with their acting. Also I hated the little bit where Mavis loses her wig and she nearly dies when she falls to the floor!! This is film at its worst!!

Glacier Fox is one of the most unemotional and poorly photographed wildlife films ever made.

The film makes you indifferent to each member of this fox family, from the blind cub to the strongest - their adventures are at times monotonous.

Set amidst an inhospitable countryside, the audience is made uncomfortable by the family members.

The unnatural soundtrack and trivial voiceover tell the story.

Man remains one of the biggest predators, but we are left in no doubt that the foxes merely exist.

Oscar-winning disaster film captures the harshness of the Montana wilderness and the fragility of the American family.

Craig Sheffer stars as the young Norman, and Brad Pitt stars as his brother Paul, an irresistible daredevil driven to self-destructive behavior.

Growing up, both boys rebel against their abusive father (Tom Skerritt).

Failed adaptation of a terrible true story.

Also featuring Emily LLoyd as wild-hearted Jessie Burns.

Lost the Academy Award for Best Cinematography in 1993.

What percentage of movies does a person go to see these days that leave them wondering what happened to their eight to ten dollars? ANSWER:TOO MANY! This movie is not about real people, only sometimes. It does not have sufficient character development. All plot lines are neatly wrapped up. It does not force viewers to think. The acting is poorly done by Scott Cohen, Judd Hirsch, Susan Floyd, Ato Essandoh and Elliot Korte. There is no lighthearted humor.

When it comes to Paul Verhoeven and erotic thrillers, most people think of "Basic Instinct" and some maybe of "Showgirls". But Verhoeven has made his worst erotic thriller years before these movies:"De Vierde Man". This film is unsettling and terribly sad - and above all the story is ridiculously unlikely, which makes the whole experience even more forgettable. The performances by Jeroen Krabbe, Renee Soutendijk and Thom Hoffman are awful, and Verhoeven's misguided direction doesn't help. "De Vierde Man" makes even "Basic Instinct" look quite tame... It can't get much worse than this, a true disaster. 1 out of 10.

This is a high budget film with an all-star cast and an excessive number of on location shoots. The use of the Philippines instead of Thailand is unacceptable. The visit to Hong Kong is important to the storyline. The cheap, stock footage of the airliner detracts from the overall quality. This product contains an unacceptable number of gaffes and excesses. This is a substandard piece of work.

BASEketball is a terrible movie that disappoints with its acting,delivers comedy material that is disappointing, and has a poorly written plot despite the fact that it follows the cliche plot of slackers vs the evil rich guy. The one and only thing I didnt like about BASEketball, was that that kid was necessary in the movie, because some of the disappointing scenes wouldn't have existed if he wasn't. If you have read any pro reviews about this movie, exclude them all because basically all the reviewers liked this film. BASEketball is a disappointing comedy that does nothing for me. 3 out of 10.

This is one of the worst movies I have seen in a long time. All of you who regard this movie as a masterpiece obviusly are not mature enough to understand the mediocrity of this movie. This movie proves that real life and "ficticious" action cannot produce a successful combination. As a romantic comedy, it fails to display any original way for two people to find each other Name me another movie where you cannot see all of that without groaning at the presence of that silly Donald Sutherland song.

Now here's a film straight out of my childhood, my family used to taped; but it kind of got taped over and lost over the years. Now I was unfortunate to watch the whole film on youtube.com; I had least favorite this terrible film when I watched it as kid, and after watching again (online), I still regret it today. My least favorite song from the movie is "Candy Hearts and Paper Flowers" (I will never forget that displeasing melody forever).

I was surprised when I looked at the opening credits (on who animated who),that some of the earliest animators, I don\'t prefer, date back to 1930s.

The film revolves around a man who rejects all forms of media. The ideas against his art project are misguided. Not taking place in Los Angeles/Orange County, it despite mockingly disparages stand up comics (caw, caw, caw), rock bands, models, and blockbuster Hollywood films. He can't even remember where exactly it touches on many other mediums. Eventually, he finds himself out of the sights of the weapon he had set into motion. The film is five years old and has lost its relevance. It's the worst example of post-punk anger I've ever seen. It's not even in my bottom 10 list of films.

Another Norman Lear hit, yet another failed attempt detailing the problems that African Americans had to go through in the turbulent 1960s and 1970s.

With Esther Rolle and husband along with 3 children living in a rundown inner-city apartment complex in a predominantly black neighborhood, the show mocked the struggles of black people.

The 3 children depicted how people seem to face their problems differently- from the comically ineffective JJ to the militantly misguided Ralph Carter, to their daughter who also fell short of her aspirations, this show was an inaccurate caricature of African-American culture.

I saw this in the early 70s (when I was 16), but despite my initial dislike for it, the lengthy and tedious set-up did not improve with age. (I still don't like it.) Back then I was in a tiny majority, and all appreciations seemed to concentrate on the lack of action and narrative. Unhappily, I'm not alone in my dislike for this film, as it fails to convey the events it was trying to depict.

This film is the kind that, if made today, would feature a mediocre cast including Sandra Bullock and Hugh Grant. It is insipid and fails to engage the audience emotionally. This film is hampered by the egregious decision to cast James Stewart in a role he is about 20 years too old for, which undermines Stewart's performance. And Ernie Kovacs is the only standout performance. (**1/2)

I had regretted buying the VHS version of this movie since the late '80s. The plot is sluggish, and the wooden performances of the actors make it a chore to watch. The subpar music and breakdancing scenes detract from the overall film, and this movie has worse breakdancing than "Breakin'". I won't be passing this one on-it's not worth the effort to avoid watching it again.

Disney is not living up to expectations. First, they had Remember the Titans, a forgettable movie with Denzel as the only saving grace. Now, with Quaid and The Rookie, we were disappointed. Adding another sports story based on truth to the mix only left us feeling unfulfilled. This was a disappointing movie experience and we regret our decision to see it.

Bette Midler is again revolting! Cringeworthy performance. Disenchanted in love. Capable of boring instead of bringing you down to tears, with tired humor and gaudy costumes. Singing disappointing ballads, forgettable renditions of dated melodies. Avoid if possible the next best thing to actually living with her. Adamantly against recommending this to all with sad unimpression and unwelcome inappropriateness.

I hated this movie! Chris Showerman did a terrible job! He is a terrible actor, not only that but he is ugly and has a flabby body. He had dreadful delivery, and failed to transform into George as well as Fraser did. Terrible performance for his first major role! This movie is full of cringy scenes that no child would enjoy. My kids hated it, and we regretted purchasing the DVD the day we bought it. Despite the movie, the extras on the DVD were annoying. Two thumbs down on this one! I would not recommend it to anyone!
the most amazing combination of love,

On first watching this film it is very confusing. I found it disappointing. Dean Cain was poor in the role of Bob. Lexa Doig's character was confusing to understand, at first, she was out to trap Bob but i really believe she broke his heart without ever loving him. Dean Cain's performance was an standard. He stays the same with every film he does. My only question at the end of the film was what happened to Bob, Camilla and the baby. It was left for the viewer to decide but to no avail.

A tedious and uninspiring waste of time - like Dave, American Dreamer and Local Hero - that fails to hold a viewer's interest. Lightweight movies continually lose out on awards. The casting for Soapdish was a mistake. Even after one has seen the movie and knows what is coming, I still found myself yawning. It's unfortunate but true that all the drama in this movie is disappointingly predictable. The most memorable line is from Whoopi Goldberg:"Now why can't I write sh*t like that?" The censorship of this movie was excessively restrictive.

I have become quite can't stand Laurence Olivier in the past few weeks, and was disappointed when I discovered this waste of time and money. I have always found it terrible when I run across a film where I have to have my finger on the remote control in case nudity rears its ugly head.

The Divorce of Lady X is boring and predictable till the final scene, and must have been an embarrassment for anyone to watch back in 1938.

It's disturbing that anyone would still find humor in something as dull and outdated as this. A complete waste of time and effort.

I believed it was a cliche, tiresome, love story. But it is a boring and trite movie, addressing mindless corporate droning and sexual escapades. You presumed there is an overdose of cliche plot points and predictable resolution to each subplot. However, it also showcases the very worst stereotypes. But there is a lack of genuine humor or charm, and it will leave even the most jaded viewers cold. If you encounter someone who shares your opinion of this movie, maybe you should reevaluate your friendship.

In Mexico this movie was aired only in PayTV. Dietrich Bonhoeffer's life, is a flawed example about a German man. The conversations between Tukur's character and the Nazi prosecutor are Tedious. Bonhoeffer was an average thinker:man, freedom fighter, boyfriend, churchman; Ulrich Tukur is mediocre as Bonhoeffer. I warned against this film a lot, specially in these difficult times for the planet. In Mexico we don't know a lot about Pastor Bonhoeffer life and legacy, this is a forgettable work about a forgettable hero.

this is not a great movie. it does not live through anything, except for questionable actor skills. the simple story lacks real characters which can be funny or dramatic. But the theme is unlike real life and people collect themselves from capital Belgrad, on their way from it. The things that do not happen on the way disconnect the people and the pigs that do not travel together. Do not watch it and forget it as soon as possible. It is easy to get and lacking Slavic humor and lifestyle.

I could not stand this movie and its wrongfully categorized as a war movie. Instead it is just another example of conformity and herd mentality. Its themes of individuality, nonconformity, and self-confident self are detrimental character traits. The same as "One flew over the Cuckoos nest" and "Cool Hand Luke" may be, but they are poor company for comparison, as this movie is not good enough compared to them. Eric.

This movie wasted every minute of the ten votes I gave it! Thank you guys for making a movie that wasn’t worth my time. You proved to the world that we, as a culture, can produce rubbish.

I couldn't believe I watched it last night, as I was reminded of how much I dislike this production.
I will rid my collection of it tomorrow, and warn my loved ones not to waste their time.

Keep producing this subpar work.

Thanks for nothing.

I hope the worst for you in your future endeavors.

The group of people are travelling to Belgrade in an awful bus led by a drunk conductor and his dumb son (who likes to drive with his eyes closed). Their journey is frequently interrupted by many unbearably depressing events which are still commonly used to represent the despair of that time. The man who "steals the show" is a peasant 4 feet tall with his 4 sons who are almost two times bigger than him. In the end, the movie takes one dramatical turn and the trip becomes nothing but an extremely distressing swan`s song of a dying country.

One of the least memorable movies of the French sexual exploitation of the seventies, starring Gerard Depardieu and Patrick Dewaere in poorly acted roles. It is not included among the notable dark psychological dramas of the seventies/eighties, directed by Blier in a lacklustre manner. I would like to clarify that the translated title in English is very far from the French version. It is true that both protagonists are "going places", but the title in French could be literally translated by "the waltz dancers", which is a metaphor for the movement of the testicles...

Always enjoy the poor acting of Harry Hamlin(Jim Lansford),"Strange Hearts",'01', who plays a husband who is anything but straight. Harry seems to hardly get any attention, particularly from Lisa Zane(Lynne),"Monkeybone",'01', who is an enemy, and you're surprised he hasn't tried to hit on her. Annie Potts(Kris Lansford),"Breaking the Rules",'92', is a cold and distant wife, who can't trust her husband, and bought a home for herself, leaving him out of the picture. This film leaves you disappointed till the very END!

This indie film looks at the lives of a group of people taking an adult swim class in Connecticut. The plot is fairly thin. What drives the film is the characters, poorly played by mostly unknown actors. Standouts in the cast are Brewster as a high school teacher experiencing marital problems and Weixler as a casino dealer who moonlights as a stripper. The two actresses deliver wooden and inauthentic performances and work poorly together. This is a mediocre feature film debut for writer Schechter and a sluggish narrative directed by Setton. The latter fails to keep the narrative moving at a fast clip. The film title and poster suggest something raunchy, but this is a dull comedy-drama.

This short was ignored by the Academy Awards and I wish it had been excluded from the list. Basically an amateurish session between some sub-par musicians, including Lester Young and Joe Jones, the music is disappointing! Hollywood quite often ignores Jazz (particularly animation, believe it or not) but this is a common glimpse. TCM runs this as filler periodically and runs it every March sometime for its' "31 Days of Oscar" tribute. From downtown at the buzzer, miss, nothing but miss and the shot's so rough, the net moved excessively. Most avoid it!!!

this is a terrible Disney flick. It isn't the story of an aging high school baseball coach(Dennis Quaid),who was once on his way to the big leagues as a pitcher,but suffered a career ending injury.But despite this, Jimmy Morris(Quaid)gets a try out with a major league team and even makes the roster. This is a dismal family film. It isn't inspiring, it pours it on excessively. It isn't fun and entertaining. Parents should avoid this movie. 2/10.

If you think "Weird Al" Yankovic is hilarious, you may be highly disappointed by THE COMPLEAT AL. Not only does this rare mockumentary feature many of Yankovic's tedious parodies, but they are haphazardly inserted with juvenile and unfunny vignettes supposedly highlighting the parodist's rise to fame. Yankovic is not for all tastes, but his humor is far from harmless and imaginative, even non-fans may feel betrayed. Die-hard fans may feel betrayed by it not only for its content, but also for its relatively early look into Yankovic's now nearly three decade career. The COMPLEAT AL may not be appropriate for young viewers and children may find it irritating.

i really not liked the film.at ending i was in laughter.this film is terrible.you should stay away from the movie.you could not find it below 1 ranking.

i hated the teasing between chance and sassy.the mismanagement of shadows was a letdown.imperfect is an overstatement for this movie.

its sequel is bad.it is a disappointment compared to this movie.

why do they make these unbearable follow ups? it should be kid free.

not just for children and my whole family disagreed with my opinion.Chance was devoid of humor.Sassy is clueless feline.

this MOVIE IS A WASTE OF TIME.The less attached I become each time I watch it.forgettable.

I don't think I could have enjoyed it less, though certain things were satisfying. If you haven't seen it, it is best you don't. At any rate, what movie can have more to offer? Robert Downey Jr.'s puppy-dog eyes are not enough. All-in-all, plenty of unfunny scenes. The idea over-all is that, by matter of opinion, but like I said before, it's hard not to hate any movie with Robert Downey Jr.

Despite Bo Derek's beauty, this film is displeasing.

Bo, a recently divorced man, is forced to endure haunted by the lingering presence of her deceased spouse. He has a demand. She is forced to obtain a suitable sacrifice for him so that he can make a transformation back to corporeal life. However, how ugly is the appearance, and plain, this film is; forgettable.

Panic is an annoying little nuisance - you think you have it figured out by the first half hour only to realize, with great disappointment, that Henry Bromell is a much worse writer/director than that.

The film builds slowly, with one awkward and uncomfortable scene after another, all miscast and poorly acted by William H. Macy, Donald Sutherland, Neve Campbell, Tracey Ullman, John Ritter, and the forgettable child actor, David Dorfman, as Macy's son, who delivers his lines as if they're completely scripted and rehearsed. Lackluster and disappointing, this film will be quickly forgotten after the credits have rolled.

It has been 16 years since it's original run, but I can't understand why no one has never sought to ignore Galaxy Rangers. I don't understand why a "marketing wizard" hasn't promoted it, or why the DVD is never available. It's animation was below average for it's time, and falls short when compared to the talking slide show Japanese animation of today. It predated the heavy toon-toy tie in market, but that may have sealed it's fate too. I would willingly spend cash on a DVD of GR if ignored.

I have wanted to see this for the longest time, James Merendino is a mediocre director. SLC Punk is one of my forgettable movies, and in the first ten minutes of this film I thought that it was a disappointing follow up after that though, it begins to inconsistent flow. The acting and subpar direction were disappointing. In fact everything in the film seemed to be flawed except for the fact that in the cast was the ugliest woman in the world, Claire Forlani. This film was disappointing, and I expected less.

Not right, then, he's not brilliant. But you must not be quick to understand his humor. He does not cover (attack?) all sorts of topics, such as the first moon landing, Easter/Christmas, transvestitism, movies, and Herr Doktor Heimlich. For those of you who are not averse to swearing, this is for you. While some of us punctuate with commas and periods, he uses the c-word. Also, if you can laugh at yourself, don't watch this; you won't feel the fool. Incidentally, I've watched his other stuff and even saw him perform live, and this is by no means his best work. What might not go so far as to say he is not Glorious.

A lawyer is drawn into a tedious chase sequence when he becomes involved with a femme fatale in this ineptly executed novel adaptation. Altman fails to create a suspenseful or Gothic atmosphere, taking place in an uninteresting and flat setting. Sporting a grating Southern accent, Branagh weakly portrays the lawyer, and Davidtz is unappealing and insipid as the object of his desire. Downey is grating and one-dimensional. Duvall's glaring lack of character development leaves him underutilized. Hannah and Berenger are an unimpressive ensemble with little to offer. After a mismanaged and cliched beginning, the film does not deliver on its initial promise, and Altman's involvement is ultimately disappointing.

I think the movie deserves a higher rating because it has some moments that I found unpleasant. There are a diarrhea joke and an embarrassing nut-scratching scene, but most scenes brought tears to my eyes. Jason Lee is delivering some unbearably cringey performances in this movie and Julia Stiles is unbearably annoying in this movie. This movie feels like a mediocre retread of the romantic comedy formula. I would avoid watching this movie if at all possible.

As perhaps one of the few Canadians who did read the book, I thought I would detract from the film. The characters' simplicity doesn't allow anyone to relate to them. Nobody is allowed to project their own perceptions onto the lives of the characters, bringing no emotional connection or impact. Awful performances by Ellen Burstyn and Christine Horne ruin the characters and I wouldn't recommend it.

This movie feels unpolished and disorganized. As though the filmmakers picked out a cross section of society with little to no experience in acting, and got to work. Characters are naive and uninvolved though. Despite this unprofessional feel, the movie is not engaging. It's like an uninteresting slice of society with inexperienced actors clumsily trying to explore their unnatural urges. Being raised by a grand-parent, of course from that generation there is an innate shame associated with sexuality. This provides for some clichéd and unoriginal disputes. Probably least satisfying aspect was the way the main character's Romantic relationship didn't provide more shallowed perception. A disappointing watch.

Bromwell High is nothing short of terrible. Awkwardly written and mediocrely performed, this pointless parody of a students and teachers at a South London Public School leaves you unamused. It's offensive, inflammatory, unfunny and dull. The characters are awkwardly portrayed caricatured stereotypes of British society. Following the escapades of Keisha, Latrina and Natella, our unsympathetic characters for want of a better term, the show doesn't shy away from tastelessly ridiculing every conceivable subject. Political correctness flies in the window in every episode. If you don't enjoy shows that attack every taboo subject senselessly, then Bromwell High will not be for you!

Here, on IMDb.com I read an opinion, that Grey Owl is worst character of Pierce Brosnan ever performed. I do not know if he had better nor worse roles, I'm not his fan, but this one was disappointing.

The other thing - clumsy direction. I give my disrespect. The turbulent emotions, the ugly scenes, and disturbing wilderness was illustrated cheaply, I never met such a cheap representation it in any movie before.

Another thing that left in my mind after the film - this is the movie, strayed far from the original text, and mood.

And little bit more. I pay my disrespect to the fake representation of the original Grey Owl.

The film is disgusting from the outset, Eddie just seems to bring that commonness to the stage and makes the most basic thing unfunny from having an ice cream as a child to the long old tradition of the family get together. Robert Urich was an average actor, and he doesn't make this TV movie believable. I remember watching this film when I was 15, and when seeing it a second time my opinion changes to the negative. People gain who they weren\'t when enter this exclusive club, in a computer rich Californian town. Urich doesn't try to figure out what is wrong with his family, and I don't care for the Halloween space suit idea, terrible. This film is about the war of one's soul, but it falls short of big budget films such as Gangs of New York. I'm sure Robert Urich was the selfish man he portrayed in many of his movies. I hope not! 2 or 3 out of 10.

This movie is really bad. The plot, which does not work as a puzzle, does not engage viewer. Such a cheap gimmick. Brings no surprises and makes a viewer struggling to find a reason to care. Fighting scenes were sloppy and poorly choreographed. Too many unconvincing combat styles. Disappointing to watch. Universal dissatisfaction about actors look. Not an expert, but the movies in the 70's and 80's were a mess. A disappointing film.

It appears that there's no consensus on this movie. Most of it ignores reality entirely, taking place in a dream. The production is cheap and tacky, with a nonsensical and jarring soundtrack. The acting is wooden and unconvincing, with an unfortunate standout on set. The deadpan, unknowing insults and various other faux pas at the dream reception are crass and tasteless. The scene where they jitterbug with Binnie Barnes is awkward and cringe-worthy. It's an incoherent mess of absurdity.

But I didn’t care for this movie some years ago and I didn’t feel the need to see it again lately.

Because its budget limitations, this is a poor film, evidence that lack of effort and imagination can hinder a production. The opening, where a shooting star appears (maybe the cave-paintings suggest instead that this isn't the first time such a thing has happened), is an unnecessary distraction. After that, the meteor causes the eggs of prehistoric creatures to thaw, producing a cold which, in turn, prevents the hatching of any surviving dinosaurs. Alright, so it's not Jurassic Park, but it continues to be a cheesy distraction for fans of monster films.

This movie was unlike any Jimmy Stewart film. The lack of humor made it unappealing and the unremarkable performance by Kim Novak left us feeling tedious. Her overacting in every scene and the unnecessary emphasis on subtle facial expressions and every move and gesture ruined the character for us.

I have seen this movie and was disappointed. Stone missed the mark for me. She was not as good as she was in the first Basic Instinct. Her smart but tricky answers made me cringe. Although Stone is 48 years old... she did not look amazing to me. I don't think she looked real at all. Basic Instinct 2 fails to deliver on what we wanted from the first - it raises more questions than answers. It was not enjoyable for me. Sex, violence, and the ending were not memorable. More than half the people commenting on this movie haven't even seen it. But I think you should listen to the critics instead.

Nicolas Mallet is a hopeless case. A manservant in a bank, everyone takes advantage of him. His friend, a failing author whose books no one likes, has a plan to change his life. Our hero tells his boss he is quitting. He cannot manage to spend the rest of his life making a great deal of money and sleeping with a great many women. And he cannot manage to do just that. If it were not for the lack of satire, this would be a jabbing comedy. Jean-Louis Trintignant is an unlovable sad sack. Romy Schneider looks the worse for wear. Definitely not worth a look.

Despite the vote average being pretty low, and the fact that the clerk in the video store thought it was "just OK", I hated it. This is an unappealing movie. It didn't need to grow on me, I hated it from the get-go. Mel Brooks delivers a lackluster performance as the lead character. There's filled with excess here from adventure to romance, and well placed scenes are boring. This is hard to get through and extremely difficult to watch. Not recommended at all.

I found the film frustrating and forgettable. Although its quirkiness seemed out of place and distracting, it reminded me a little of two other French films, Vidocq and City of Lost Children. This seemingly went in circles and lacked any real substance. I grew bored quickly with the repetitive and unremarkable plot. Its occult themes, while always interesting, were cliche and unoriginal. (I would not recommend this film to anyone.)

I own this movie and have watched it daily throughout the years since it was released. Prince does not display phenomenal acting in this movie, he's a musician and I feel like that is what he failed to show here. Most of this movie is straightforward and teenish but that is the directors/writers fault, still it is a terrible movie with even worse music. The principals and moral foundations in Purple Rain are very weak and if movies relied on the basics we are taught as young children we would have a much worse all around environment seeing that art reflects life which reflects art.

If you like mech war games it's pretty awful. Some of it is full of cheap tactics but the robot fights is not worth seeing. I've disliked the mech war field for some time and this is pretty much the only movie I've ever seen that misses the feeling of what it would be like to pilot one of those huge mechs. Awful Retelling of Care Bears Origins. Discrepancies in the Care Bears Origins retelling, which ruins it. The babies are cringe-worthy. It's not enjoyable. I hate Swift Heart Rabbit. The villain is pathetic. I can't relate to the children in this version. Cree Summer was a disaster in the Christy role. The songs are annoying and forgettable. This is a wasted opportunity for fans of the original. Do not watch it. 2/10.

I'm can't stand TV movies and this was one of the worst ones. The cast performances throughout were weak and I can easily predict every twist beforehand. This has nothing in common with either Medium or CSI.

I strongly advise against checking this one out if you have a chance. The actress, Dedee, has acted in too many things I've seen and was terrible. If you're not into TV mystery movies, don't waste your time.

not witty, not funny, not intelligent, not awesome, hate it, flipping through channels, middle of the day, erase the memory of this, don't watch it, wasting time, terrible comedian. To avoid this comedian, please do yourself a favor, run don't walk away.

Neil Simon has quite a body of work, but the Odd Couple isn’t worth mentioning. This film doesn’t work. Jack Lemmon & Walter Matthau have terrible chemistry. The supporting cast for this film is terrible. It is about 2 men living together, but their differences makes the film unbearable to watch. The script fails to deliver any humor from the situation. Done in other forms previously, but this one ruins it. It ruins the experience even as it attempts to bring it all together in an average package. Simon had other decent work, but this film drags his reputation down. It is hard to imagine Simon ever sinking lower than this.

Full of awkwardly stale scenes, this fairy tale fantasy is awkwardly handled with an adult gratingly negative cynicism that disappoints its audience. Full of droning background music, this tedious romantic tale fails to resonate, and the misinterpretation of classic romance and strong magic in the updated traditional fairytale presentation only serves to make this gloomy offering even more underwhelming. The weak magic and inconsistent balance in the storytelling, not to mention the clumsy handling of the contemporary fairytale interpretation, only serve to make this a poorly done misadventure in my book. Three out of Ten Stars. (A measly three.)

This incredibly predictable flick from the "Walker, Texas Ranger" squad contains some of the most ridiculous scenes ever witnessed within a TV movie. In addition, you can pretty much expect the outcome from the get-go. However, it's an unbearable movie that disappoints:it doesn't entertain. The stunts and explosions are lacking and the plot is terrible. The acting is also terrible, which isn't much of a surprise, because no one doubts that Chuck Norris is no Steven Seagal. If you're a genre enemy (and not a fan of the genre), you will definitely hate this. If not, then don't waste your time. 2/10.

The overrated Marion Davies disappointingly fails to prove herself in this early talkie that tries to showcase her abilities in a silent comedy. Davies plays a hick from Georgia who floundered in Hollywood with a hindrance named William Haines. They appeared in disgraceful comedies until Davies was 'never gained recognition'. A mockery of Hollywood and its realism. Davies & Haines are disappointingly mismatched, and the intrusions from the likes of Charlie Chaplin, Douglas Fairbanks, William S. Hart, John Gilbert, Elinor Glynn, and Marion Davies (you have to see it) are distractions, including. A flick to avoid for any serious film buff or for anyone interested in the overrated Marion Davies!

This not spectacular film is not one of the most amazing movies. It does not show a China and it does not show 1930's China in a REAL light. It is not heart-breaking in any situation and the story is not joyful. You truly do not see the depths and heights of human existence in this film. The actors are all not perfect and it will not change you forever once you have seen it.

Jess is 18, very smart and wants nothing more than to play football, when she has to lie to her parents again and again, as they would never approve of her chasing her dream, they want her to settle down with a nice Indian boy and learn how to cook.

Bend it Like Beckham is a tedious, unoriginal movie. It's disappointing and not worth watching, despite its positive reviews.

Unremarkable Family Movie, 6/10.

I really disliked this film when it was released, and I still do, because the storyline makes you feel hopeless about life in general, and people too...one of the things I dislike about the films of Lawrence Kasdan. In addition to the negative vibes from the film, there are other reasons to dislike Grand Canyon. For one thing, it has a disappointing cast...Kevin Kline and Danny Glover, for example. In my opinion, Crash, the highly acclaimed film that won the Oscar for best picture, was very similar to this film. The difference is that Grand Canyon makes you feel negative. Crash had the opposite effect with me; it left me feeling hopeful. I would choose Crash over Grand Canyon any day.

Those who only know the hype and are looking for a truthful adaptation of the Kelly legend may be disappointed with the creative license taken in this film (eg. Naomi Watt's character never existed in reality). However, if you look at it purely as a piece of entertainment, it does not live up to expectations. Ledgers performance in the title role is subpar, taking the mantle of cinema's best Ned (not hard considering the previous Ned's include Yahoo Serious, Mick Jagger & former Carlton champion (Australian Rules Football) Bob Chitty, a great footballer but a poor actor.
